main event: Sighting of a tear-shaped object with metallic blue or bluish green light over Arkansas City, Kansas on the night of 18 July 1956, observed by multiple witnesses including police officers and military personnel. The object was seen for 40 minutes before fading away.
interesting points: The object appeared like a large light bulb with orange and green points and was estimated to be at an altitude of 5 to 6000 feet.
Radar at the Hutchinson Naval Air Station picked up an unidentified target moving in a semi-circular area east of Hutchinson, prompting an investigation.
Winds aloft in the area of the sighting corresponded exactly to the course of the object.
Witnesses in several Kansas communities reported seeing similar tear-shaped objects with strange lights, prompting investigation by multiple Air Force bases.
The sighting caused speculation and discussion among hundreds of people, with some attributing it to waste gas torches in an oil field, while others remained mystified.
sighted object: Tear-shaped object with metallic blue or bluish green light
